intro: Pedicularis giraldiana, commonly known as the Giraldiana lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, often pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Pedicularis giraldiana thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
